title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Lael Brainard, appearing at her confirmation hearing to be the Fed's No. 2 official, said efforts to reduce inflation are the central bank's "most important task."

Producer prices closed out 2021 near the highest level in over a decade, though December showed a slight cooling of producer inflation.

Major U.S. stock indexes fell, dragged down by tech shares, with the Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow losing 2.5%, 1.4% and 0.5%, respectively.

Delta Air Lines said it expects to shake off the impact of Omicron, which knocked the company's operation off course and damped revenue at the end of the year.

Microsoft's board said it would review the company's sexual-harassment and gender-discrimination policies and unveil a summary of the results of past investigations.

Shares of TPG rose 15% in their stock-market debut, notching a valuation of roughly $10.4 billion for the private-equity firm.

TSMC said it would increase its investment to boost production capacity by up to 47% this year amid the global chip crunch.
